location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:92 x 95 mm [portrait]Format:1 albumen print pasted to backing paper and mounted between pp. 34-35Materials:Silver printing-out paper, albumen printCondition:The print is unevenly hand-cut, with some light ink splatter-marks on the left-hand side in particular.Foliation:‘5’Process:Albumen print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This three-quarter length seated studio portrait of a young woman is intended to demonstrate an ethnic or class ‘type’, in this case that of a ‘half-caste’ woman. She wears a simple dye-patterned garment and a polka-dot shawl, which covers her head and right shoulder. Beneath her shawl appears to be another, more close-fitting piece of material, which may be a silk kerchief intended to conceal her hair.Inscriptions:In pencil, upper left corner adjacent to print: ‘5’
